news.headline: Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) Q1: Beats On Revenue
news.summary: Semiconductor equipment maker Lam Research (NASDAQ:LCRX) reported Q1 CY2024 results exceeding Wall Street analysts' expectations, with revenue down 2% year on year to $3.79 billion. The company expects next quarter's revenue to be around $3.8 billion, in line with analysts' estimates. It made a non-GAAP profit of $7.79 per share, improving from its profit of $6.99 per share in the same quarter last year.

news.headline: Chip Gear Maker Lam Research Returns To Earnings Growth, Ups Outlook
news.summary: Lam Research handily beat expectations for its fiscal third quarter and guided higher than views for the current period.

news.headline: Lam Research forecasts quarterly revenue above estimates on AI chip boom
news.summary: Lam Research supplies equipment to chip manufacturers, whose businesses had taken a hit in 2023 due to a glut of certain semiconductors used in personal computers and smartphones.  Some of those electronics categories are showing signs of recovery even as an AI-boom is prompting chip firms to build new capacity, lending a cascading upside to vendors such as Lam Research.  "As our customers address the challenges in scaling semiconductors to meet the power and speed requirements for driving AI transformation, Lam is strengthening its leadership and is well-positioned for the significant opportunities ahead," CEO Tim Archer said in a statement.

news.headline: Lam Research Stock Slips Despite Solid Earnings
news.summary: For the March quarter, the semiconductor equipment company  reported revenue of $3.8 billion, up 0.9% from a year earlier.  On an adjusted basis, Lam earned $7.79 a share, beating both the midpoint of the company’s guidance range at $7.25 and the consensus estimate at $7.30 a share.  “With solid revenue and earnings per share performance in the first quarter, Lam is off to a strong start in calendar 2024,” Lam CEO Tim Archer said in a statement.

news.headline: After Nvidia and Apple, Alibaba Chases Vietnam: New Data Center to Boost Control and Meet Local Laws
news.summary: Alibaba Group Holding Limited (NYSE:BABA) plans to construct a data center in Vietnam to meet legal requirements for local data storage and to cater to increasing demand in one of Asia’s fastest-growing economies. Currently, Alibaba rents server space from Vietnamese state-owned telecommunications companies Viettel and VNPT.
